
# rabbit.zsh-theme

A ZSH theme optimized for people who use:

- Git
- Unicode-compatible fonts and terminals (I use iTerm2 + Menlo)

![Screenshot](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/165302812/342793506-7822e850-a226-4d33-a62e-10b8c36f8257.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJnaXRodWIuY29tIiwiYXVkIjoicmF3LmdpdGh1YnVzZXJjb250ZW50LmNvbSIsImtleSI6ImtleTUiLCJleHAiOjE3MTkzMzAxMDcsIm5iZiI6MTcxOTMyOTgwNywicGF0aCI6Ii8xNjUzMDI4MTIvMzQyNzkzNTA2LTc4MjJlODUwLWEyMjYtNGQzMy1hNjJlLTEwYjhjMzZmODI1Ny5wbmc_.zeU5DsmHrC_SGedY0go-ro1jOZjJzCrejpVgQEArqPE)

# Compatibility

**NOTE:** In all likelihood, you will need to install a [Powerline-patched font](https://github.com/Lokaltog/powerline-fonts) for this theme to render correctly.

## What does it show?

- the virtual environment.
- Working directory
- Git status
